answers.answer: My first I was sick  and tired til I had him. Now my second no sickness no tiredness. Both boys lol!

My first was bad morning sickness for first three months. Got gestational diabetes and had to be induced at 36 weeks for high blood pressure. And that was my little girl. I am now 38 weeks with nothing wrong. Didn't have any type of sickness and this will be my boy. This pregnancy is going by smooth.

My mother in law has three kids and says each pregnancy was totally different. With her first (a boy) she didnt have any sickness at all and didnt gain much weight, with second (a girl) she was sick and threw up the whole pregnancy and didnt gain much weight and with her last one (a girl) she was only sick her first trimester but was huge and she had problems with losing weight after she gave birth. So i guess its normal to have completely different pregnancies with each baby :)
Yes! This is my second and its way different my first i had no morning sickness it went smooth and this pregnancy i had sickness always tired all the time and i also.feel so fat

Yes with my first it was great all I had was headaches and nausea. With this second pregnancy I am getting all different symptoms and being in pain a lot. The only things in common are the nausea, headaches and sleepiness.

question: Is anyone else finding their second pregnancy totally different to their first? My first was so smooth, no sickness,  no bad back no real tiredness, this time round I feel like I've been hit by a bus feeling sick everyday, not sure if that's working a 30 hour week and having an 8 year old son but definitely feel this one is different so wondering whether it's a girl this time around. I'm 12 weeks have my next scan on Friday.
title: 2nd pregnancy
